greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, n-th row = first n terms of n-th row of an array formed by A051731 * A127093(transform).
comment: The function T(n,k) = T(k,n) is defined for k>n but only the values of k 1<=k<=n as a triangular array are listed here.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
formula: Given an array formed by A051731 * A127093(transform), extract the first n terms of row n to form the triangle.
example: First few rows of the array are:
First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: T[ n_, k_] := If[ n < 1 || k < 1, 0, If[ k > n, T[ k, n], If[ k == 1, 1, If[ n > k, T[ k, Mod[ n, k, 1]],  DivisorSigma [1, n]]]]] (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 18 2011 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if( n<1 || k<1, 0, if( k>n, T(k, n), if( k==1, 1, if( n>k, T(k, (n-1)%k+1), sigma( n)))))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 18 2011 */
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 14 2007
ext: Missing T(10,9) = 1 inserted by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 12 2015
